thread.title: Flight manifest of crashed Bristow Helicopters chopper released
thread.title_full: Flight manifest of crashed Bristow Helicopters chopper released

author: eTN Global Editor
title: Flight manifest of crashed Bristow Helicopters chopper released
text:
Flight manifest of crashed Bristow Helicopters chopper released   
Aug 20, 2015 eTN   
LAGOS, Nigeria - Nine days after the Sikosky S76 C+ chopper belonging to Bristow Helicopters with the registration number 5N-BGD crashed into a lagoon at the Owowronshoki area of the Third Mainland Bridge in Lagos, Accident Investigation Bureau, AIB, released the flight manifest to the public. 
The manifest released by the bureau confirmed that 12 people were on board the ill-fated flight, including two crewmembers, as reported immediately after the crash. 
AIB in its statement did not however clarify the names of the survivors, but Bristow Helicopters in an earlier statement confirmed that the two crewmembers on board, Capt. Joseph Wyatt and the co-pilot, Peter Kayode Bello did not survive the crash. 
Online media statement signed by the spokesman of AIB, Mr. Tunji Oketunbi gave the names of the people on board as Mr. Ita Ekpeyong, Joshua Emekeme, Dolu Ebiejuara, Onoriode Onojete, Chukwuma Erise and Solomon Udeh. 
Others were Chidi Ukwunta, Iniala Opaimi, Chris Abua, Chukwudi Onah, Joseph Wyatt (Captain) and Peter Kayode Bello (Co-Pilot). 
The helicopter had crashed on Wednesday August 12, 2015 shortly before landing at Murtala Muhammed Airport, Ikeja, Lagos. 
The helicopter had departed SEDCO oil platform offshore en-route to Lagos airport. 
Before the release yesterday, AIB and the Nigerian Civil Aviation Authority, NCAA, had avoided the release of the manifest to the public, insisting that it would only do so when all the family members of the victims were contacted. 
However, a source close to the airline confirmed that it authorized AIB to release the manifest to the public after it had contacted all the family members of the people on board the chopper.
